title: Google Project Maven Employee Resistance: 4,000 Workers Force Pentagon Contract Abandonment (2018)
description: Document the successful resistance by nearly 4,000 Google employees against Project Maven, the company's $15 million Pentagon contract to develop AI for analyzing drone footage, establishing crucial precedents for tech worker resistance.
research_areas: What was the timeline of employee organizing against Project Maven in 2018?
Which specific employees led the resistance and how was it coordinated?
How did Google executives respond to the employee pressure?
What role did media leaks play in amplifying employee concerns?
How did this victory establish precedents for future tech worker resistance?
source_requirements: Internal Google communications, employee petition records, executive decision memos, media coverage, Pentagon contract documents
pdf_source: Technology Worker Resistance and Constitutional Cryptography_ Tools for Democratic Resilience.pdf
